heading: 1.1 Mutational signatures
text: Underlying cancer hallmarks genome instability, generates genetic diversity expedites acquisition, inflammation, fosters multiple hallmark functions (Hanahan 2011). Cancer genomes typically harbors 1,000 mutations small (e.g., point mutations, short insertions deletions) large scale (e.g., copy number variations, rearrangements). Genomic contexts mutation may accumulate response endogenous processes exogeneous exposures. recent years, computational approaches (typically non-negative matrix factorization (NMF)) applied mutation catalog analysis human/mouse tumors detect characteristic mutational patterns, also known “mutational signatures”.
